data.title: This is Why Uwe Bristol is the Perfect University For International Students
data.meta_description: Looking to study abroad? UWE Bristol is the perfect university for international students, offering top-quality education and a welcoming environment. Find out more here. Contact AECC.
data.text:
If you are an international student who is considering studying in the UK, there are a lot of universities to choose from. One university that should definitely be on your list is the University of the West of England (UWE Bristol).

UWE Bristol is ranked among the top 50 UK universities by The Guardian University Guide. The university has a strong focus on employability, with 95% of graduates either working in some of the highest-paid jobs in the UK or further studying within six months of graduation.

This is one of the globally respected institutions in the UK with partnerships and collaborations with over 600 universities and businesses worldwide. Another reason why the university stands out from the crowd is that it offers over 600 courses for students to choose from, including undergraduate, postgraduate, and research degrees, as well as professional development courses.

UWE Bristol has a strong sustainability reputation, committed to reducing its carbon footprint and promoting environmental awareness among students and staff. Another amazing thing about UWE Bristol is that it is located in one of the UK's most vibrant and culturally rich cities, with easy access to the countryside and coastline of the South West.

All this information has now intrigued you to know more about UWE Bristol, hasn't it? Well, let's dive into the article then!

UWE Bristol international tuition fees

One of the most important factors for international students when choosing a university is the cost of education. UWE Bristol offers competitive tuition fees, and there are also a variety of scholarships and bursaries available to help students with the cost of studying. The university also offers payment plans to make it easier for students to manage their finances.

Undergraduate tuition fees - International students are charged within the range of £15,250 and £15,750 depending on their course. This is for all the full-time courses.

Postgraduate tuition fees - The postgraduate tuition fees do not come within a standard range and usually change according to the course that has been chosen by the student.

For all the part-time courses, a pro-rata amount of the full-time equivalent is charged as tuition fees.

UWE Bristol Frenchay Campus

The main campus of UWE Bristol, the Frenchay Campus, is a 15-minute bus ride from the city centre. The campus covers over 300 acres of land and features a range of modern, purpose-built facilities. Some of the exceptional facilities that are available for students here include a students' union, a 24/7 library, shops, cafes, restaurants, and sports centres.

Students' union - To make the services easily accessible to the students, all of the students' union facilities are made available in one location.

The students' union has a set of student reps who work together to ensure that the voices of students are brought to light. With the help of the students' union, the students can participate in volunteering activities, societies, and sports, and hence build their networks.

Sports centre - The sports centre has some top-of-the-range equipment, amenities, and playing surfaces. The campus has excellent sports facilities, including a sports centre, a 3G sports pitch, and outdoor courts and pitches for tennis, football, and basketball.

Apart from some of these much-needed facilities, the Frenchay Campus is home to the Faculty of Business and Law, the Faculty of Engineering and Technology, and the Faculty of Environment and Technology, as well as the Bristol Business School and the Bristol Law School.

Student accommodation at UWE Bristol

One of the essential as well as exciting parts of studying abroad is choosing where you are going to live throughout your course of study – because at the end of the day, home is where the heart is!

UWE Bristol offers on-campus accommodation facilities for international students and the application for the same opens on 10th June 2023.

Apart from this, the Frenchay Campus of the university has a student village that provides accommodation for students.

There are four courtyards in the village such as Brecon, Cotswold, Mendip, and Quantock. Each of these courtyards have flats, each of which six students can share.

UWE Bristol international scholarships

Scholarships can help more students fulfil their dream to study in the UK. Having a financial backup in the form of a funded scholarship can enhance the experience you gain as an international student.

Here are some of the popular scholarships for international students offered by the university:

Global Buddy Scholarship - International students who achieve a grade average of 70% are eligible for a 25% fee discount on their first year of an undergraduate or postgraduate degree.

Academic Achievement Scholarship (Gold) - International students who achieve a grade average of 80% are eligible for a £2,000 fee reduction on their first year of an undergraduate or postgraduate degree.

Academic Achievement Scholarship (Silver) - International students who achieve a grade average of 80% are eligible for a £1,500 fee reduction on their first year of an undergraduate or postgraduate degree.

Vice Chancellor's Scholarship - A direct 50% fee reduction for selected full-time and part-time postgraduate courses.
